reviews.review:
Solid writing and flashy graphics turn beaten metaphors, poor level design and a mediocre plot, with a fast and loose understanding of physics, into a surprisingly fun game that social sciences students should enjoy.

7/10, would play on hard or 1999 mode
(would only buy on sale with a 50%+ discount)

A recent and compelling gaming with an amazing storyline. Graphics and overall atmosphere is well set out with each of the character's personalities developed well throughout the game. The sky-line adds another dimension to the already lush combat system while the fun and very useful vigors create room for tactical playstyles. As with all the Bioshock games, the twist comes when you never expect it. 9/10.
Suosittelen!  ;)  <3

Ye gods and goddesses! To describe this game as "beautiful" would be like describing the Sun as "a bit on the warm side."

I originally bought BI as part of a package deal which included all three of the DLCs, so I was fortunate to be able to play the entire epic without having to wait between releases. The story is stunning, and stunningly told. Although [I]Infinite[/I]'s storyline is self-contained, and prior familiarity with the Bioshock universe isn't necessary to fully enjoy it, those who have played either of the other two [I]Bioshock[/I] games will almost certainly want to pick up both episodes of [I]Burial At Sea[/I] as well--they not only add new depth to [I]Infinite[/I]'s plot, but they go one step further and provide some simply mindblowing tie-ins to the first two games in the series. I'll bet dollars to doughnuts you'll never look at Rapture the same way ever again once you're done (I just finished Episode 2 of Burial at Sea earlier this evening, and I'm still getting chills thinking about the ending).

Of course, given that [I]BI[/I] is an actual game as opposed to a movie, there's a great deal of action here as well (with some very impressive attention to physics to boot). While the plot itself moves on fairly linear rails, the player has a great deal of freedom to move about the train on their own, so to speak. Which is a definite bonus, because if your idea of eye-candy includes attention to detail, then you'll find a great deal to snack upon here. 99% of the game's action occurs in a version of late 19th-century/early 20th-century America, and the game designers clearly did their research, right down to the backdrops (friendly note of warning: that period of American history was highly, publically racist, and the developers decided to incorporate those attitudes into the scenery without apology. While you won't find anyone spouting the dreaded "n" word, other racial slurs are mentioned from time to time. But it's all done so naturally that I never once found it detracting from my overall enjoyment of the game. The designers were simply being true to history, which I can respect for the immersion value).

The voice-acting and the dialogue are both top-notch, and possessing the same attention to historical detail as the world in which the characters speak their lines. And some of those lines are truly marvellous in both their writing and delivery--[spoiler]My personal favourite being, "Elizabeth! Your mother...is raising...the dead."[/spoiler]

Let's see...I suppose I should take some time and talk about some of the more technical aspects of playing this game, eh? Players are given the option of using either a controller or the traditional keyboard/mouse setup, with a variety of presets to choose from for the former, and fully configurable key-bindings for the latter. I can't imagine anyone having issues with the controls--if something seems awkward, it's a piece of cake to go into the options menu and change it at any time. The number of options for tweaking graphics, alas, isn't nearly as robust--but it isn't allll that limited, either. Unless you're the sort of person who just can't be happy unless they're able to micromanage their graphics settings, I don't think you'll have any complaints.

I wish the same could be said for the way the game handles saving your progress. [I]Infinite[/I] exclusively uses an auto-save feature (aka "checkpoints"), and while it fortunately [I]does[/I] seem to provide a reasonable number of said checkpoints, I remember there being a few places where I groaned in frustration after having been reset to the complete beginning of an area because I stopped playing before I was able to reach the next savepoint. At least the game gives a pretty clear visual indication of when a savepoint has been reached (an animated icon in the upper right corner of the screen), as well as actually telling you the time of your last savepoint when you first exit out of a session. All things considered, I found it a minor quibble, but YMMV.

The only other caveat I want to mention is that the game doesn't kid around with its listed "minimum" and "recommended" hardware requirements. Even if you have a graphics card that meets the recommended specifications, if your processor is subpar then you're likely to experience moments of stutter during particularly intense fights, especially if you try running the game on high graphic settings. Fortunately, the game's still pretty gorgeous even if you DO have to play with lowered settings for the sake of performance, but if your PC can actually handle the load, you'll be well-rewarded in terms of visual appeal. Will you ever!

[B]TL;DR: [/B]It's worth the price, whether on sale or not. It'll suck you in and keep you there for many wonderful hours. If I knew then what I know now, I wouldn't have waited so long to buy the game myself. I can't speak much for the game's replayability (apart from the _Conflict in the Clouds_ DLC, which provides solo arena-style gameplay), but honestly, in this case I don't think you'll really notice. By the time it's all over, you'll walk away knowing you have enjoyed a truly grand gaming experience.

Unless you're a philistine, but let's assume you aren't.

Просто лучший сюжет 10 из 10, графон 10 из 10. геймплей заслужил бы доработки эти еб№чие  трассы х№й пойми куда ехать стрелки всё время разворачиваются, да и бои не очень можно просто прыгать на всех с трассы по очереди а закончатся патроны и Элизабет даст тебе еще немного. в общем 7 из 10. Have you played the first two BioShock games? If you answer yes, continue. If you answer no, play them first. For maximum enjoyment and understanding of the story, this is a must.

The main thing that stands out in BioShock Infinite is its storytelling. It took me a while to get into it, not even caring about it for a while, but then it kicked off and enthralled. The ending...my mouth was open in shock and awe the ENTIRE time of the ending for the game. It's that good, especially if you played the other BioShock games.

Gameplay is fun too. It doesn't change up too much from the previous titles, so if that was your cup of tea then this will be too. Think a good first-person shooter mixed with powers and skyline riding (which, by the way, is more enjoyable than I could have guessed).

Make sure to grab the Season Pass, or just the two Burial at Sea episodes, they help close the chapter on the epic tale that is BioShock Infinite.

La historia del juego es realmente atractiva, hace que uno no quiera parar de jugar hasta terminar el juego. Te causa un enredo mental que a medida que avanzas vas descifrando y entendiendo. Genera una admiración hacia el mundo en el que se da, la época, la física, química y sobretodo esa maravillosa ciudad, Columbia. Te genera diferentes sentimientos como: Alegría, tristeza, miedo, desasosiego, ansias, desespero, asombro, etc.

Por otra parte el motor físico y las gráficas del juego son extraordinarias, la iluminación, el reflejo, las texturas y el movimiento fueron muy bien trabajados y perfeccionados, pero lo que se lleva todos los créditos es Elizabeth. Si ese AI que te acompaña la mayoría de la historia, y que por primera vez en un juego, es útil. Su forma de moverse, de interactuar con el mundo es asombrosa, encuentra dinero, municiones, eve y medicina para ti, además de indicarte rutas hacia objetos, recordarte que olvidaste algún diario, abrir candados para ti y además descifrar códigos ocultos. Algo de lo que más me gusto es que cuando le apuntas con el zoom de las armas, se mueve rápidamente, quitándose de tu camino y permitiéndote apuntar libremente, no como en otros juegos que los acompañantes son totalmente estúpidos.

Este “Shooter” es sin duda alguna el mejor que he jugado hasta el momento. ¡No me puedo imaginar, y ya me trae ansias el próximo!
One of the best FPS games i've had the pleasure of playing in awhile. i would recommand this game to anyone!

I don't like this game. Not because there were glitches or because I found it to be too difficult but rather just because it is not a good GAME. There is absolutely nothing new or interesting. It doesn't have charm. It doesn't have intelligence. But that doesn't make it a bad game by itself. I love playing games like doom or duke nukem where there isn't much depth and the entire goal is just either "shoot the baddies" or "make it to the end". Those games are fun so they don't need to be smart. It's not a bad game because it doesn't have depth and is not fun. It's because it's just a game designed to look deeper than it is. And it's not deep. It claims to setup the world as a backdrop for the lead characters, but there is no real world to help frame the characters. It's just set-dressing. All the times when you think you make a choice (deciding who to throw a ball at, picking emily's broach) are pointless. I am aware that it is claimed that the choices serve the game's themes including saying the choices don't matter but in that case isnt it just as pointless to include it? Speaking of pointlessness why exactly was this a first person shooter anyway? In what way, if any, does that help the story? The gameplay aspects are horrificly bad so I don't think it was to make it fun (because it doesn't) so the only thing left is for it to attempt to serve the story. It does not do that. It's only a detriment. Is booker meant to be a man or some sort of space marine super soldier? The FPS aspect serves only to confine the player. There is no freedom of movement that might bring life to the setting. And the setting is what is supposed to be the selling point if i'm correctly informed. So why do something that would deminish it? To make way for more lightning and fire from your hands? Why are the TONICS even included? Because the developers liked them in bioshock so much? In bioshock they served as both a gameplay element but also, more importantly, as a vital plot element. In bioshock infinite they have no story purpose. And when you are trying to get a game to seem "deep" and "intelectual" you really need to make sure that the GAME part of the game is complimentary to the story part. The only thing "deep" about this game is the convolutions. If a game leaves me asking why a character is doing something instead of something else that makes much more sense then it needs to be explained! You can't just not mention it and assume the player doesn't think about it. In a game that wants to seem so smart it sure misses the simplest things.

This is the first review I have ever written, but this game made me want to provide some comments. I truly enjoyed Bioshock Infinite and the game kept me interested and excited to the very end. The story line was brillant and the ending was a great surprise. I had to replay the ending to ensure I understood it. The graphics are awesome and the character acting was very good. I truly enjoyed this game. What's next from Bioshock and 2K?

Ich versuche es zu Updaten und dann wirds kurz eingereit dann Plöp brich er die Updates ab. Bei LoadOut Borderlands etc. hat er sie alle gemach nur hier nicht weiss jemand warum?

Игра - шедевр.
В последнее время все реже нас радуют хорошими играми, так вот перед вами наилутшая игра. Мне довелось пройти ее с первокласной русской локализацией от SGInfo, им отдельная благодарность.
Перед вами не просто шутер, перед вами история в которой стрельба это второстепеное. Вас в очередной раз окунают в "утопию" в которой не всё так просто, а финал настолько не предсказуем и трагичен, что взрывает мозг и заставит разрыдаться самого мужественного человека.
Мир, атмосфера и музыка на высоте. Хочется чтоб игра ни когда не кончалась.
Если ты её только покупаешь и скоро впервые запустшь - я тебе искрене завидую.

Ich muss sagen das Bioshock Infinite Der Beste Ego-Shooter ist den ich je spielte. Wo es anfangs noch eher ruhig war und dann zu eine spannenden, spaßigen und interensaten Story wurde. Am Ende war ich sehr verwirrt, um das Ende zu verstehen muss das Hirn schon ein wenig Arbeiten oder man  sollte das Spiel nochmal durchspielen. Ich kann es nur weiterempfehlen. Und außerdem nehmt euch die "Zeit" und schnüffelt etwas herum. ;)
クソバランス　終わり。
Ein wirklich einzigartiges Spiel mit einer genialen und packenden Story, das es nicht langweilig werden lässt. Mir hat es großen Spaß gemacht und kann es nur weiter empfehlen!
Uno de los mejores juegos de la epoca

Крутая, атмосферная,красивая и интересная игра. Сюжет сложноват, вникнуть непросто (я даже потом в текстовом виде прочитал концовку чтобы было более понятно). Начало 20 века, в интерьерах, зданиях, людях - все это очень хорошо воссоздано, хочется ходить и смотреть, заходить в разные лавки, подходить ко множеству разных прохожих, смотреть на пейзажи Колумбии. Есть небольшая вариативность в действиях (например кинуть мяч в несчатстных над которыми насмехаются из-за каких то странных понятий Колумбии или же в мерзкого ведущего, который ,собственно, предлагает кинуть мяч в них, или выбрать украшение для Элизабет). Геймплей хорош, разнообразные пушки, способности главного героя, прыжки на аэоротроссы и скольжение по ним с помощью крюка (с них, кстати, можно спрыгнуть на врага или остреливать их при движение на троссе). Очень хорошая игра, по-моему 10/10. Покупать стоит, не пожалеете.
Это очень, очень крутая игра. Сюжет, геймплей, управление - все удобно. История зацепила сильнее всего. Не игра, а ловушка.
Fantastic story. Breathtaking in the end. (97/100 in my book).

Замечательная игра и очень захватывающая!! 
10/10
A fantastic game of a fantastic series. Beautiful, great story, 10/10

Boring! It's a step backwards from the first Bioshock in that it's lacking all creativity. It's just corridor after corridor of bullet sponge enemies. And the two gun limit makes it even worse, because upgrading is too expensive when you're just gonna have to swap out your gun for whatever is on the ground when you run out of ammo. Ziplining and calling in automatons was fun. If only more of the game was like that. And the Vigors were more of a crutch then a special attack. Some enemies absolutely required you use a specific one on them, or they would demolish you before you could barely hurt them. I should also note, I'm talking about playing on hard mode. Maybe it's less tedious on normal?

And then there is the story. It was a convoluted mess. I feel like they had a beginning and an end, then slapped together everything in between. There was a neat twist, and the characters were likeable, but the story was just a mess.

One of the first and best FPS games I've played so far. Just as good as the first BioShock. This game has a great story to it, and wonderful graphics. It is truthfully easier to play the second time around. This is a game in which you possibly can play for a number of times and never get bored!
Frist game I brought on steam, might as well start out with a good game.
Any fans of the first bioshock - buy this game. Very fun, love the new game mechanics.
Really interesting fun game. A bit too linear, felt like an 'on rails shooter' but generally really fun.

Though this game was far from any of the other Bioshock games in terms of game play, it is, in fact, a Bioshock game. The story deviated from the original two games of the trilogy, but ultimately tied itself in towards the end. The concept of it all is hard to understand at first, but with a little research (and completion of the game of course) it all becomes clear. I give this game a solid 9.8. The -.2 is for the little to no reference of the previous two Bioshocks until the DLC. Other than that it is a great game and I look forward to seeing where 2K Marin will take the Bioshock multiverse next.
Прекрасная атмосфера, необычный визуальный ряд, качественный геймплей и захватывающий сюжет.
Like a thrilling rollercoaster!!! Would ride again 10/10

Bioshock Infinite holds the place for my personal favorite FPS game. The game looks amazing and it's got a great story with plentiful twists. The combat is kept fresh by earning new weapons and vigors to play with along with the skylines and tears. Elizabeth serves as an actually useful companion throughout the game because she'll throw you supplies you're running short of during fights. It's got a decent level of difficulty and moderate music. The DLCs are great too, Burial at Sea takes you back to the Rapture we all know from the first two games, along with it's creepy and disturbing atmosphere. It also includes new vigors and the classic weapons from Bioshock 1. Clash in the Clouds provides short-term fun by letting you gear up and fight waves of various enemies, earning cash and completing tough tasks along the way. The only thing wrong that I could find with the game is it's checkpoint system, but that isn't bad enough to alter my rating.

Pro/con summary:

Pros:
Beautiful graphics
Good story with plot twists
Fresh and exciting combat
Decent music
Useful AI companion
Great DLCs

Cons:
Checkpoint system

9/10

Ich entfehle bioshock jedem der auf  "Mindfuck Momente" , eine gute Story , Beeindruckende Maps und ein abwechslungsreiches Kampfsystem steht :D

[h1] Bioshock není hra. Bioshock je životní styl! [/h1]

Ve světě her se pojem FPS táhne již od prvních pixelových krůčků a od prvních vizuálních slov. Je to vlastně prvorozený celého herního průmyslu, který již od svého začátku vrhá obrovský stín na ostatní druhy her. Za krále prvorozených by se dalo považovat Call of Duty, které se nám zarývá do hlav již celá léta, ale i tento král má svůj stín ve kterém se nám pomalu rozrůstá nový uchvatitel FPS trůnu. Bioshock. 

Třetí syn Irrational games s tajemným přívlastkem [i] Infinite [/i], nás místo do temných hlubin oceánu unáší do prosluněných oblak naoranžovělé barvy a na rozdíl od ostatních FPS her, které by nás tam poslaly pouze za účelem zbarvit oranžovou do ruda, nás Bioshock Infinite posílá prozkoumat na pohled hezký svět jménem Columbie, který má ale zkažené srdce. Hra začíná velmi pěkně. Jste vržen do světa vytvořeném v již ověřeném Cry Enginu, který patří dle mého názoru mezi jedny z nejlepších a to hlavně díky tomu, že hra vypadá opravdu nádherně a to i přes poměrně malé nároky. Prvních pár minut jste pouze unášen plujícím městem a poodhalujete co vás asi tak bude čekat. Je to jako pít velmi dobré pití a vy pouze lačníte po dalším a dalším loku ale… tak dlouho se se džbánem chodí pro vodu, až se… Columbie utrhne. Bezspoilerově mohu říct jenom to, že v tomto světě nejste prostě vítán (jste v něm doslova zakázán) a z náhlé změny atmosféry vám naskáká tak husí kůže, že byste na ní mohli strouhat ovoce. Přece jenom Columbie má být něco jako mýtický ráj a zakázané ovoce přeci chutná nejlépe a tak začíná vaše honba za krásnou mladou dívkou, která má ty nejhezčí herní oči jaké jsem kdy viděl.

Hratelnost hry patří mezi opravdové AAA prvky, které by měla mít každá hra s cenou nad dvacet euro. Bioshock Infinite má přece jenom stále titul „akční“ a to právem. Souboje jsou vám servírovány přesně na čas. Nečekejte to, že celu hru projdete pouze s prstem na spoušti. Občas budete mít dokonce i na výběr zda se probojovat nebo pouze projít. Při hraní si pamatujte, že násilí opravdu není vždy řešení! Ale když na to přijde, můžete nadělat z Columbie pořádná jatka. K dispozici budete mít na výběr několik kouzel (zde představených v podobě vigorů), které bude možno mezi sebou kombinovat a to jakýmkoliv způsobem k tomu budete moci ještě použít velmi rozsáhlý arzenál zbraní a to nejlepší nakonec… Elizabeth, dívka, kterou máte chránit, má určitou schopnost pomocí které, může otvírat brány do jiných světů. Navíc si můžete své vigory a zbraně vylepšovat což vám zajistí nikdy nekončící zábavu. Obtížnost hry se postupně zvyšuje stejně jako zamotanost příběhu a tak první dohrání hry určitě nebude vaše poslední a tak se nemusíte bát, že nevyzkoušíte všechny možné kombinace zabití, které vám hra nabízí. 

Bioshock Infinite je opravdu akcí, dějem i dojemností nabitá hra, která nikomu neleze do zelí. Docela by mě zajímalo, jak by u takové hry vypadal multiplayer. Ano… možná by to už nebylo ono, ale to si mnozí říkaly, už když se dozvěděli, že by třetí Bioshock měl být v oblacích, místo pod mořem a jak to dopadlo? Hodnocení: [i] Až na výjimky kladné [/i] hovoří za vše. Zatímco ostatní FPS s každým novým dílem pomalu upadají do oceánu obyčejné smrtelné rudé krve, Bioshock s každým svým novým dílem stoupá nahoru a svou krev mění z obyčejné na královskou modrou a musím uznat, že mu to jde opravdu dobře.
This game is amazing

Bioshock Infinite:

I do believe that this game deserves an in depth review from me. I consider Bioshock Infinite to be the greatest video game masterpiece yet made. It has made me view games 
in a different perspective. It has showed me that games can be a form of art. Bioshock Infinite succedes in everything that it does. It has taken game storytelling to the next level,
it has renewed bioshocks gameplay and improved it and it has once again made the most facinating game world and setting. When all of it is mixed together it obviously makes an perfect game.  


Story
This is where Bioshock Infinite truly shines, the story. You are Booker DeWitt (VA Troy Baker), a private investigator and a war veteran with a debt to settle. 
To clear the debt you must rescue Elizabeth (VA Courtnee Draper), a mysterious girl imprisoned for her whole life in the sky city of Columbia. Simple as that, guess again.
I was a lot of fun following the story especially Elizabeth on your side. She is the emotional center of the game and she is easily the most functional and best game follower ever made.
It is incredible how the character change throughout the game. How Elizabeth changes in the game is probably the saddest thing in this game. It might seem like simple and
relatively happy game, but trust me closer you get to the end, darker the story gets. Thing that amazed me is how Bioshock Infinite goes from a simple job to the 
unbelievable ending that none of us saw coming. 
This is truly the most unforgettable and intense game story ever made

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=178743331


Game World and Atmosphere
"What is Columbia if not a another ark in a different time".Bioshocks are known for their unique game worlds and Bioshock Infinite delivers it yet again. Now it takes place in the sky city 
of Columbia and the year is 1912. Columbia is easily one the most beatiful and well made game worlds out there. During the first 20 minutes it feels ridiculous but yet amazing.
After some time, your start to see how well is this city made, the rasist, xenophobic and the religious people makes the city feel so natural and alive. During the gameplay you will truly feel
that you are in a early 20th century utopia built into the sky.


http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=135697019
 
 
Gameplay
Bioshock Infinite has largely improved the gameplay over bioshock 1 and 2. Guns are awesome and vigors (aka plasmids) are powerful. Combat is now more diverse, you can move rapidly through the battlefield with new sky-rail 
system. Guns in bioshock infinite are much more accurate and effective. Using then are much more fun then in bioshock 1 and 2 but this time you can only carry 2 weapons. Its both a good thing and a bad thing. 
Probably the best new thing in the gameplay is Elizabeth, She'll throw ammo, med kits and salts just the right time. She will even revive you if die and find you money when 
you most need it. Another thing that Elizabeth can do is, bring you cover, turrets (etc) with her tears. A Tear is a rip in dimensional time and space, revealing an alternate universe.
Elizabeth isnt just a helping hand during fight. When you are out of combat she can lockpick doors and she is also a talented codebreaker. You will mainly be looting money, 
gears and infusions from the city. In a nutshell gameplay is fast and brutal but most of all, fun. 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=178743607


Soundtrack and Audio
Like my pal Mr. Anderson once said "One of the best soundtracks ever".Bioshock Infinite has excellent musics and audio FXs. Music of Bioshock Infinite is driven by small string quartet style that feels lighter
and brighter as you explore sunny environments. Quickly turning dark and menacing when things go wrong. Game also contains old timey covers of pop songs found here and there, such as, tainted love and fortunate
son in a 1912 version. The sound effect sound absolutely mesmerizing. An firemen exploding his fuel tank, the ambient sounds of columbia or the punching sound of a shotgun. These are just great examples of amazing
sound effects which are heard throughout the game. Only soundtrack and audio design equal to Bioshock Infinite is The Last of Us.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=135697091
 

Graphics
Graphics in Bioshock Infinite are stunning and extremely well optimized as well. Bioshock Infinite uses Unreal Engine 3 which explains the good visual quality and performance. Weapon and character models are extremely well textured,
the lighting changes throughout the game and is most likely handcrafted.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=135697280


Verdict


Bioshock Infinite is truly an masterpiece and its a game you shouldnt miss. Even though it only lasts about 13 hours,(about 19h with DLCs)its an very high quality over quantity. If you are looking for game with good plot, atmosphere, gameplay and 
graphics, then Bioshock Infinite is definitely a game for you.

Final verdict:
  
The most unforgetable game experience EVER!

10/10

What this game achieves is something truly marvellous and forever memorable. It sits at the apex of not only thoroughly excellent gameplay mechanics and level design, but with exceptional artistic and visual design, and storytelling which is as good as gets in gaming – in fact, Bioshock Infinite’s story is truly outstanding, and is immensely satisfying both intellectually and emotionally. This one-of-a-kind FPS is just simply one of those extraordinary games that only comes around once every few years, and is a testament to the very best of originality and the art of game design.

If you did not play the original, don’t worry, as the story is seemingly very nicely contained. But if you play the Burial at Sea DLC, then I must say it is a must for previous Bioshock players who loved the story, as it is truly a remarkable experience that ties the whole series together in a way I would have never thought possible, and is singlehandedly the most transcendental DLC I have ever come across story-wise.

Данный обзор - это сугубо мое мнение, вы в праве быть не согласны со мной.
По началу игра посылает игрока в неизведанное и приподносит сюрпризы. "Кто эти люди, плывущие со мной?", "Куда я попал?", "Что за маяк?", "Что за труп?", "Что за красное свечение?",  "Зачем я сел в это кресло и куда меня собираются отправить?" и вообще "Что за хр*нь здесь творится?" (Извините за выражение), вот, что крутится на уме у геймера в начале игры. Через несколько секунд он попадет в "рай", повсюду неимоверная красота, приветливые граждане, город, летающий в облаках, но вот не задача, тут многие белые люди ущемляют права чернокожих. И вроде бы ладно, хрен с ним (Опять же, извините меня), но вдруг вы становитесь врагом народа №1. И тут начинается... Спойлерить не буду, кому надо - пройдут игру, а кто-то уже все это знает.
Теперь по пунктам, начну с минусов, т.к. их меньше (на мой взгляд):
- Боевка, а именно стрельба однообразна и скучна.
- Таков же и поиск лута.
Плюсы:
- Не ясно: что, как и почему, что  за люди преследуют нас (женщина и мужчина) на протяжении всей игры, что притягивает игрока, придает игре шарма, ее хочется проходить, хочется вникать в сюжет. (Даже после полного прохождения не до конца многие понимают, что и как).
- Энергетики (Энергетики прокачки персонажа, его возможностей и т.д.)
- Помощь Букеру от Анны Д. Взаимодействие с ней.
- Сама героиня Анна Д. (Элизабет).
- Графика просто шедевральна.
- Музыка высший класс.
- Игра берет атмосферой.
- Ну и конечно же СЮЖЕТ и КОНЦОВКА.
Моё впечатление об игре:
Сюжет, как и концовка, бесподобен. У меня нет слов, чтобы его описывать, игрок сам должен прочувствовать все эмоции, все, что испытывает Букер и Элизабет. Скажу лишь, что он очень запутан и эта не та игра, которую надо просто пробежать за 3-5 часов. Это своеобразная книга, в которой надо уделять свое внимание каждой мелочи. Вслушивайтесь в разговоры людей на улицах, в разговоры героев во время пострелушек и после них. Все это нужно, чтобы как можно лучше понять сюжет данной игры. Концовка непредсказуема. В конце у игрока так или иначе останется больше вопросов, нежели ответов на них.
Касательно дополнений:
Мы получили дополнения, которые якобы помогают нам понять все, что произошло до этого. На деле, игрок еще больше запутывается в собственных мыслях и доводах. Но к концу более-менее, как и в оригинале игры, становится все ясно. А еще, в "Burial at Sea-ep.2" можно играть за  няшку Элизабет :)
Моя оценка такова: 10 Элизабет из 10 (10/10), не смотря на ее вышеперечисленные недостатки. После прохождения игры и дополнений осталась чертова куча эмоций, которую я выплеснул здесь, спасибо за прочтение.
P.S. И всё же, жалко мне Соловья.
